ygData.msgSnippet: kale eusi wrote:  ... Now you have a new armor that might be better than rubi to look forward to. It s just a guess, but I wouldn t be surprised to see
ygData.messageBody:
kale eusi wrote:
<snip>
> I would have liked to have gotten a rubi BP for the regen properties. Not to
> mention that the red hue looks outstanding on a DESK! 8) Getting rubi armor
> was one the few last things I had to look forward to for my DESK, (seeing as
> how they continuously nerf everything else worthwhile for SK's). I just wish

Now you have a new armor that might be better than rubi to look forward to. It's just a guess, but I
wouldn't be surprised to see that the new armor types look the exact same as rubi. It seems easier
than having to code new graphic info for each and every new set of armor. I mean, it's not like the
rubi graphic will get used as much as the armor that is replacing it.

> Verant would think these things out before they go nerfing them the way they
> always do, and then they end up spending the next 2 months or so trying to
> undo what they did to correct the original problem. It would have been much
> better/easier to make rubi no drop/trade lore, or even make it a quest
> reward (something like crafted, but not quite so easily obtained).

You have a point in that they seem to look before they leap. I actually think this is one example
where they actually came up with a plan instead of "Just make it No Drop. That will solve the
problem." Making things no drop does not solve the problem, it just hides it for a while.
